description: Audsley describes this stop as a small-scaled wooden flute of 8' pitch, resembling the Flauto D'Amore, and used by Steinmeyer and other German builders. He describes its tone as �soft and pleasing�. Locher considers it a synonym used by Steinmeyer for Flauto d'Amore and Flauto Amabile. (Audsley lists those stops separately.) Irwin also lists it as a synoym for the Flauto Amabile. The name Vox Amorosa has apparently been used for a celeste (see examples below). Compare with Amoroso.
examplesDescription: Amorosa 8', Hauptwerk (Epistelorgel); Passau Cathedral, Passau, Bavaria, Germany; Steinmeyer 1924.

examples.name: Amorosa 8', Hauptwerk (Epistelorgel); Passau Cathedral, Passau, Bavaria, Germany; Steinmeyer 1924.

Vox Amorosa II 8', Celestial; Calvary Church, Charlotte, North Carolina, USA; Moller 1990.
